contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Radio Station| | image = | name = XHMORE-FM | city = [[Tijuana, Baja California]] | area = [[Tijuana, Baja California|Tijuana]]/[[San Diego, California|San Diego]] | airdate = [[1994 in radio|1994]] | frequency = 98.9 ([[Megahertz|MHz]]) | branding = MORE FM 98.9 | slogan = M치s Rock En Espa침ol | format = [[Rock En Espa침ol]] | erp = 50,000 [[watt]]s | haat = 71 meters| | class = B | callsign_meaning = '''MORE FM''' | affiliations = | owner = [http://www.cbc.com.mx/ Cadena Baja California]; Operated by [http://www.mecnetwork.net/ MEC Communications] | licensee = | sister_stations = [[XEBG-AM]], [[XESPN-AM]]<br />''Also part of the CBC Cluster: TV Station [[XHBJ-TV]]'' | webcast = [http://cbc.com.mx/xhmore%20989/escucha%20en%20vivo/mobil/morefm989.m3u Listen Live] | website = [http://www.cbc.com.mx/MoreFM989.html MoreFM989 ] |}} '''XHMORE-FM''' ('''XMOR-FM'''), or '''MORE FM 98.9''' is a [[Rock En Espa침ol]] station serving the [[Tijuana, Baja California|Tijuana]]-[[San Diego, California|San Diego]] radio market. The station, whose city of license is [[Tijuana, Mexico|Tijuana, Baja California, Mexico]] and broadcasts at 98.9 [[MHz]] with an ERP of 50,000 [[watt]]s. ==Recent history== For a number of years prior to [[1993 in radio|1993]], XHMORE had programmed a Top 40/CHR format with most of the music being in english and the presentation in Spanish. By 1994 it evolved into a Rock en Espanol format as "More FM" during its first incarnation, which lasted until 2004, when it flipped to [[English language|English]] [[rhythmic contemporary]] as "Blazin' 98.9". Market competitors included [[XHITZ-FM|XHITZ]] licensed to Mexico and [[KHTS-FM|KHTS]] licensed to the United States. In 2009, the music stopped and the station adopted a [[sports radio]] format and was the local [[ESPN Radio]] affiliate. On October 6, 2010, ESPN Radio was replaced by the current format (the Rock en Espanol format in its second incarnation) and the language of broadcasts changed from English back to [[Spanish language|Spanish]]. The current ESPN Radio affiliates are [[XEPRS-AM|XEPRS]] and [[XEPE-AM|XEPE]]. ==External links== *[http://www.cbc.com.mx/MoreFM989.html Official Website] *{{FMQ|XHMORE}} *{{FML|XHMORE}} {{Tijuana Radio}} {{coord missing|Mexico}} [[Category:Radio stations in Tijuana]] [[Category:Spanish-language radio stations]]
